@description.name: @description
@description.body: Color

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Solve the 2 dimensional linear equation 

    ( A00 A01 ) (x0) = (y0)
    ( A10 A11 ) (x1)   (y1)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Solve the 3 dimensional linear equation 

    ( A00 A01 A02 ) (x0)   (y0)
    ( A10 A11 A12 ) (x1) = (y1)
    ( A20 A21 A22 ) (x2)   (y2)

raw: * Change the color by changing one of it's components.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Change the color by changing one of it's components. Expected values are:

  • h, s, v: 0…1
  • r, g, b, w: 0…1
  • T: 1667…25000 Kelvin
  • x, y, Y: 0…1
  • L, C, h: 0…1

raw: * Get the value(s) of the specified component
* - L, a, b: 0...100 for `L` and roughly -150...150 for `a` and `b`

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the value(s) of the specified component Value ranges are:

  • h, s, v: 0…1
  • r, g, b, w: 0…1
  • T: 1667…25000 Kelvin
  • x, y, Y: 0…1
  • L, a, b: 0…100 for L and roughly -150…150 for a and b
  • L, C, h: 0…1

raw: * Create a new color by calculating (1-ratio)*thisColor + ratio*otherColor.
* The blending is done by mixing the LCh coordinates.
* otherColor must have the same base colors xy coordinates, as this
* is not checked or even enforced doing a blend between such different
* colors will create an undesired result.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create a new color by calculating (1-ratio)thisColor + ratiootherColor. The blending is done by mixing the LCh coordinates. otherColor must have the same base colors xy coordinates, as this is not checked or even enforced doing a blend between such different colors will create an undesired result.
